Article Title: Samsung plans big for India's AC market; to launch over a dozen models with 'connected features' and more
Article Text:
Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra is expected to come with Galaxy AI features

After a record-breaking summer for air conditioner sales in India, Samsung India is set to relaunch its residential AC business with a focus on premium, smart features. The company plans to introduce over a dozen inverter AC models in its 2025 lineup within the next few weeks, expanding its offerings to 15-16 SKUs, according to industry sources.These new room air conditioners (RACs) will incorporate Samsung's Bespoke AI solutions , targeting consumers seeking high-end ACs with advanced features. This move marks Samsung's return to a market where it once held a significant position, boasting over 15% market share in 2014-15 before shifting focus to other product categories like mobile phones and smart TVs.The Indian appliance market is currently experiencing a trend of premiumization, with consumers increasingly willing to pay more for energy-efficient and connected devices. Samsung aims to capitalize on this trend, projecting double-digit volume growth in its RAC segment in 2025. While Samsung sold approximately half a million units in 2024, holding a low single-digit market share, the company anticipates achieving a double-digit share with its new Bespoke AI-powered lineup in the highly competitive Indian RAC market.The Indian RAC market, estimated at around 11 million units, is dominated by established players like Voltas, LG, Daikin, BlueStar, Hitachi-Johnson, Panasonic, and Lloyd. The industry saw exceptional sales growth of 30-40% in May and June due to a severe heatwave. Factors such as rising temperatures, urbanization, and increasing incomes are driving demand for ACs in India. The market is also evolving with the availability of more energy-efficient models and increased domestic manufacturing of components.While an email to Samsung India for comment went unanswered at the time of reporting, the company's re-entry into the RAC market signals a renewed focus on this growing segment.
Article Summary: Samsung India is set to relaunch its residential AC business with a focus on premium, smart features. The company plans to introduce over a dozen inverter AC models in its 2025 lineup within the next few weeks. The new room air conditioners (RACs) will incorporate Samsung's Bespoke AI solutions.

Article Title: Amazon sets this 'China condition' for sellers on its website in the US
Article Text:

Sellers Caught in the Middle

Amazon denies

Chinese sellers are reportedly caught in the crossfire as Amazon fights to maintain dominance in the ecommerce market in the United States (US). According to a report in South China Post, "Amazon.com has asked some Chinese cross-border merchants to stop offering goods at a cheaper price on rival platform Temu ." The report added that the local office of Amazon recently informed the managers of some top-selling Chinese brands that they should not list identical items at a lower price on Temu.Adding fuel to the fire, Anker, a popular brand on Amazon, recently removed its listings from Temu's US marketplace. This move fueled speculation that Amazon pressured Anker to prioritize its platform. However, Temu maintains its commitment to "fair and open competition" and said that it believes offering products across platforms benefits consumers with more choices and better deals.Temu is owned by Chinese e-commerce giant PDD Holdings . The ecommerce website has gained popularity rapidly since its launch in the year 2022. Its aggressive pricing strategy is said to be attracting US consumers and threatening Amazon's market share. Temu was the world’s third-most-visited online marketplace after Amazon and Alibaba Group Holding’s AliExpress, according to November data from Similarweb.Sellers who violate this rule risk losing their placement in Amazon's coveted Featured Offer program, which gives products prime real estate on product pages. A Featured Offer, also known as the Buy Box, is prominently displayed at the top of an Amazon product page, alongside the “Add to Cart” and “Buy Now” buttons, making it easier for customers to purchase the featured item rather than the same product sold by other merchants.Recently, Amazon launched Haul, an app section that sells goods priced under $20 aimed to take on competition from the likes of Temu and Shein.Previously, Amazon excluded Temu from its price comparison system, potentially due to concerns about counterfeit products on the platform. However, with Temu's growing success, Amazon seems to be changing tactics.This situation puts Chinese sellers in a difficult position. They need to balance lower prices on Temu's platform, favored by the algorithm, with maintaining good standing on Amazon, crucial for reaching a wider audience. Some sellers are resorting to changing product pictures on Temu to avoid detection by Amazon.An Amazon representative denied the report and said that “sellers decide their selling strategy and set their own product prices in the Amazon store, and Amazon does not ask them to set certain prices.”
Article Summary: Chinese sellers are reportedly caught in the crossfire as Amazon fights to maintain dominance in the ecommerce market in the United States (US) According to a report in South China Post, "Amazon.com has asked some Chinese cross-border merchants to stop offering goods at a cheaper price on rival platform Temu."

Article Title: Sanctions-hit Russia turns to cryptocurrencies for international trade
Article Text:
Putin criticises use of dollar as political weapon

Russia is increasingly turning to cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin for international payments as it seeks to navigate Western sanctions and reduce its reliance on the US dollar, a report has said. The changes come after sanctions were imposed on Russia after its war with Ukraine hampered trade with China and Turkey.Citing Russia’s finance minister Anton Siluanov, news agency Reuters reported that the companies in the country have begun using digital currencies in foreign trade following recent legislative changes that legalised their use.Russia legalised the use of cryptocurrencies in foreign trade and has taken steps to regulate cryptocurrency mining. Russia is a major player in Bitcoin mining, and Siluanov highlighted that Bitcoin mined within Russia is already being used for international payments.“As part of the experimental regime, it is possible to use bitcoins, which we had mined here in Russia (in foreign trade transactions ),” Siluanov told Russia 24 television channel.“Such transactions are already occurring. We believe they should be expanded and developed further. I am confident this will happen next year,” he said, adding that international payments in digital currencies represent the future.Earlier this year, Siluanov urged the public to stay away from crypto investment.“Some people see cryptocurrency as a source of quick money. I don’t recommend it as a means of investment,” the minister statedEarlier this month, Russian President Vladimir Putin criticised the US for using the dollar as a political weapon, arguing that this has undermined its role as the global reserve currency and driven countries to seek alternative assets like Bitcoin.
Article Summary: Russia legalised the use of cryptocurrencies in foreign trade and has taken steps to regulate cryptocurrency mining. The changes come after sanctions were imposed on Russia after its war with Ukraine hampered trade with China and Turkey. Russia is a major player in Bitcoin mining, and Bitcoin mined within Russia is already being used for international payments.

Article Title: NPCI issues an advisory about 'online scams' that Indians are losing crores to
Article Text:
What NPCI advisory says

What is digital arrest scam



How to identify a digital arrest scam

Unexpected Contact from ‘Officials’: Be cautious if someone claims to be from government agencies like the police, CBI, income tax officers, or customs agents, contacts you. Be cautious especially if they claim urgent legal action is being initiated or warranted. They might allege that you or one of your family members is involved in a serious crime like money laundering, tax evasion, or drug trafficking.

Fear-based language and urgency: Scammers may request video calls, disguising themselves in police uniforms, using government logos, or creating official-sounding background noise to appear legitimate. They often threaten arrest or immediate legal action, demanding a quick response and using legal terms to sound convincing. In some cases, they create a police station-like set up to further convince victims of their credibility.

Request for sensitive information or payment: Scammers may ask for personal information or demand large sums of money, promising that this will clear up your involvement in the alleged crime. They may also coerce you to transfer money to their account until the investigation is complete. Terms like “clearing your name”, “assisting with the investigation”, or “refundable security deposit/escrow account” might be used by them to persuade you into transferring money to specified bank accounts or UPI IDs.

Tips to stay safe

Pause and Verify: If you receive unexpected calls or messages about legal issues, take a moment to verify. Stay calm, as scammers rely on fear and urgency. Real government and law enforcement agencies will never ask for money or investigate cases through phone or video calls. Always confirm the caller’s identity and consult trusted sources before taking any action.

Use Support Channels: Report suspicious numbers to the national cybercrime helpline by dialing 1930 or the Department of Telecommunication (https://sancharsaathi.gov.in/sfc/).

Article Title: Airbnb blocked 74,000 bookings worldwide on New Year eve in 2023, and says will follow same measures in 2024 as well
Article Text:
How Airbnb checks ‘party’ booking

Planning a New Year's Eve party at an Airbnb? Think again. The company is deploying anti-party technology globally to prevent "unauthorized and disruptive" gatherings during the holiday season. This technology uses machine learning to identify and block risky bookings, focusing on factors like trip length, booking timing, and distance from the guest's location. While implemented worldwide, the technology will specifically target the US, UK, Australia, Canada, France, Puerto Rico, Spain and New Zealand. Last New Year's Eve, Airbnb blocked 74,000 such bookings.High-risk bookings will be blocked or redirected to alternative accommodations. Short holiday getaways (one to three nights) in entire homes will also be restricted, and guests booking entire homes will be required to agree to a "mandatory anti-party attestation." "If a booking is identified as higher risk, the guest will either be blocked from booking, or redirected to alternative accommodations on the platform," the company said.Guests will also be required to accept mandatory anti-party attestation. "Guests who can make reservations will need to confirm that they understand that disruptive and unauthorized parties are not allowed on Airbnb, and they face suspension or removal from the platform if they violate this policy," said the company.Airbnb also has a 'Neighborhood Support Line' for local communities to report urgent issues, like a party in progress, at a home they believe is listed on Airbnb.Airbnb's efforts to curb disruptive parties started in 2019 with a ban on "party houses," followed by stricter measures in 2020 due to the pandemic. In 2022, the company permanently banned large parties worldwide following several violent incidents at Airbnb rentals, including a shooting in Pittsburgh that resulted in two deaths and eight injuries.
Article Summary: Airbnb is deploying anti-party technology globally to prevent "unauthorized and disruptive" gatherings during the holiday season. The technology uses machine learning to identify and block risky bookings, focusing on factors like trip length, booking timing, and distance from the guest's location.

Article Title: Japan Airlines says systems back to normal after cyberattack cripples ticket sales, flights
Article Text:
[Notice regarding network equipment malfunction as of 19:40]

There was a system malfunction with our network equipment today, but it has now been resolved.

As of now, flights for tomorrow, December 27th, are scheduled to operate as normal.

We apologize for any inconvenience caused.

No customer data leaked

Japan Airlines (JAL) has restored its systems and resumed ticket sales after a cyberattack disrupted domestic and international flights earlier on Thursday (December 26).The attack, which began at 7.24 am local time, affected both internal and external systems, prompting JAL to temporarily shut down a malfunctioning router and suspend ticket sales for flights departing on Thursday.JAL assured that no customer information was compromised and that the company suffered no damage from computer viruses. ANA Holdings, Japan's other major airline, reported no impact on its systems from the cyberattack.As per news agency Reuters, the disruption led to delays of more than 24 domestic flights, with delays exceeding 30 minutes each.While Japanese authorities investigated the incident, local media suggested that the disruption could be due to a distributed denial-of-service (DDoS) attack, where networks are overwhelmed by concentrated data traffic from multiple sources.Chief Cabinet Secretary Yoshimasa Hayashi directed the transport ministry to expedite system restoration efforts and ensure proper accommodation for affected passengers.Earlier in the day, television footage showed crowds of stranded travelers at Tokyo's Haneda airport. The disruption coincided with the start of Japan's New Year holiday season, which is the country's peak travel period.This incident comes on the heels of a technical glitch that grounded all American Airlines flights for an hour on Christmas Eve, disrupting travel for thousands of passengers.
Article Summary: Japan Airlines (JAL) has restored its systems and resumed ticket sales after a cyberattack disrupted domestic and international flights earlier on Thursday. The attack, which began at 7.24 am local time, affected both internal and external systems, prompting JAL to temporarily shut down a malfunctioning router and suspend ticket sales. JAL assured that no customer information was compromised and that the company suffered no damage from computer viruses.

Article Title: How AI chatbots’ ‘biggest problem’ is helping scientists in healthcare
Article Text:
AI hallucinations speed up hypotheses

While the general consensus on AI “hallucinations” – the generation of plausible but false information – are concerning, scientists are increasingly recognising their potential for driving innovation and discovery, report has said, adding that these unexpected outputs from AI models are proving surprisingly useful in fields ranging from medicine to climate science.According to a report in The New York Times, AI hallucinations, or inaccurate or misleading outputs can spark new ideas and accelerate the scientific process. AI hallucinations arise when generative models are trained on a specific subject and then allowed to rework that information, sometimes producing unexpected and even surreal results.“The public thinks it's all bad. But it's actually giving scientists new ideas. It's giving them the chance to explore ideas they might not have thought about otherwise,” Amy McGovern, a computer scientist and director of a federal AI institute, was quoted as saying.According to the scientists, this ‘creative aspect’ of AI is proving valuable particularly in the early stages of scientific discovery , where hunches and guesswork often play a crucial role. AI hallucinations can speed up the process of generating and testing hypotheses, leading to faster breakthroughs.James J. Collins, an MIT professor, recently praised AI hallucinations for accelerating his research into novel antibiotics.“We're exploring. We're asking the models to come up with completely new molecules,” he said.The impact of AI hallucinations is evident in the work of Nobel laureate David Baker, who shared the 2024 Nobel Prize in Chemistry for his research on proteins. Baker credited AI hallucinations with helping his lab design millions of brand-new proteins not found in nature, leading to numerous patents and the founding of over 20 biotech companies .
Article Summary: AI hallucinations arise when generative models are trained on a specific subject and then allowed to rework that information, sometimes producing unexpected and even surreal results. According to the scientists, this ‘creative aspect’ of AI is proving valuable particularly in the early stages of scientific discovery.

Article Title: As post on Uber charging different from iPhone and Android users go viral; company clarifies
Article Text:
Read the LinkedIn post here



A colleague recently booked an Uber ride on two different phones simultaneously, from the same pick-up point to the same drop-off point. 🚗📱

He wanted to improve his chances of getting a ride during peak hours.

- On Android, the fare was ₹290.79.

- On iPhone, the fare was ₹342.47.

What’s going on here?

This isn’t a glitch—it’s design thinking in action, driven by data and user insights:

1️⃣ User Behaviour: iPhone users are often perceived as “premium customers”—data shows they’re more willing to pay higher prices.

2️⃣ Platform Fees: Apple charges up to 30% commission on in-app purchases, subtly influencing pricing decisions.

3️⃣ Dynamic Personalisation: Apps increasingly use

dynamic pricing

based on user behaviour and profiles. Your choice of device could impact what you’re charged.

Here’s the real question:

When does personalisation improve user experience, and when does it start to feel exploitative?

From a design thinking perspective, this approach is rooted in understanding user behaviour and adapting to it.

For businesses, it’s smart—leveraging data to optimise value.

For users, it’s complicated—does this pricing strategy enhance the experience, or does it break trust?

What we found out in our testing

What Uber has to say

A recent social media post alleging that Uber charges different fares for rides booked on iPhones and Android devices has started an online debate. The post, which quickly went viral, showed screenshots of two phones displaying significantly different fares for the same ride. The post ignited speculation among users, with many questioning whether Uber's pricing algorithm discriminates based on the type of device used.Nirali Parekh shared her colleague's experience of booking an Uber in a LinkedIn post. In the post, she highlighted the significant price difference for the same trip when booked using an Android smartphone versus an iPhone.The same post was shared by the Uber user on X (formerly known as Twitter). “Same pickup point, destination & time but 2 different phones get 2 different rates. It happens with me as I always get higher rates on my Uber as compared to my daughter’s phone. So most of the time, I request her to book my Uber. Does this happen with you also? What is the hack?,” posted Sudhir on X.To investigate these claims, TOI Tech conducted its own tests. We booked multiple Uber rides using various devices, including budget-friendly Android phones and premium Apple iPhones. However, we did not observe any significant price variations across different devices or locations.Uber quickly responded to the allegations, stating that the observed fare differences were not due to the type of phone used. "Hi there, multiple differences in these two rides impact the prices. The pick-up point, ETA, and drop-off point on these requests vary, which will cause different fares. Uber does not personalize trip pricing based on a rider's cell phone manufacturer," the company explained.
Article Summary: A recent social media post alleging that Uber charges different fares for rides booked on iPhones and Android devices has started an online debate. To investigate these claims, TOI Tech conducted its own tests. We booked multiple Uber rides using various devices, including budget-friendly Android phones and premium Apple iPhones. However, we did not observe any significant price variations across different devices or locations.

Article Title: "Crock of bullsh*t": Namita Thapar counters Narayana Murthy's call for longer work hours
Article Text:
Namita Thapar slams Narayana Murthy's long work hours advice



Anupam Mittal's perspective on Narayana Murthy’s long working hours philosophy



Narayana Murthy's call for longer work hours: Catalyst for the debate



A broader conversation: Work culture in transition



The debate over India's work culture and the suggestion of a 70-hour workweek has sparked significant discussion across the country. Two prominent figures from Shark Tank India , Namita Thapar and Anupam Mittal , recently shared conflicting perspectives on this topic during an interview with Humans of Bombay. Their contrasting views have fueled ongoing conversations about the balance between productivity, success, and well-being in the modern workforce.Namita Thapar, CEO of Emcure Pharmaceuticals, strongly opposed Mittal's stance, labeling his argument a "crock of bullsh*t." She argued that the expectations for founders and regular employees differ significantly, especially when financial stakes are involved."For founders and high stakeholders, who make tons of money — go for it. Work 24 hours a day forever!" Thapar said. However, she stressed that expecting the same commitment from employees is unreasonable. She highlighted the disparity in financial incentives, citing her own experience: "When Emcure went public, it was valued at $3 billion, and my family owns 80 percent of it. Obviously, we could work 20 hours a day, which is what we all do. But the employee? My accountant, for instance, doesn’t share the same financial upside."Thapar raised concerns about the physical and mental health implications of extended work hours, particularly for employees who lack the same financial motivation as business owners. She emphasized the importance of maintaining a balanced schedule for overall well-being and long-term productivity.Anupam Mittal, founder and CEO of Shaadi.com, argued that success cannot be measured by the number of hours worked. Reflecting on his own experience working 16-hour days during his early career in the U.S., Mittal emphasized that dedication and focused effort outweigh mere time spent on tasks."I think it's a big lie being told to this generation," Mittal remarked, challenging the notion that longer hours equate to greater achievements. He advocated for prioritizing work-life "harmony" instead of adhering to rigid time commitments. According to Mittal, young professionals should be prepared to push themselves early in their careers but also recognize the importance of creating a sustainable balance.Highlighting the hybrid work model implemented at his company, Mittal revealed a 30% increase in productivity. He credited this approach for fostering both efficiency and flexibility, enabling employees to deliver better results without overextending themselves.The debate was reignited by recent comments from Infosys co-founder Narayana Murthy, who suggested that India’s youth should commit to longer work hours to boost productivity and global competitiveness. He cited historical examples from Japan and Germany, where extended work weeks played a role in post-war economic recovery.Murthy's call for a return to a six-day workweek and extended hours drew both support and criticism. Proponents view it as a necessary step to enhance India's economic output, while detractors argue it disregards the importance of work-life balance and employee well-being.The exchange between Thapar and Mittal underscores the complexity of India's evolving work culture. While both acknowledge the need for change, their views highlight differing approaches to achieving productivity and fostering professional growth.Thapar champions the idea of reasonable work limits for employees to avoid burnout and prioritize health. On the other hand, Mittal believes that extraordinary success requires dedication and effort, regardless of fixed hours.The conversation also reflects a larger trend in global work culture, as organizations grapple with finding the right balance between flexibility, efficiency, and employee satisfaction.Also read | Airtel recharge plans
Article Summary: The debate over India's work culture and the suggestion of a 70-hour workweek has sparked significant discussion across the country. Two prominent figures from Shark Tank India recently shared conflicting perspectives on this topic. Their contrasting views have fueled ongoing conversations about the balance between productivity, success, and well-being in the modern workforce.

In 2010, Shashi Kumar, a Bengaluru-born tech professional, made a transformative decision that would bridge the gap between technology and agriculture. After a successful 17-year career in the technology sector, including 13 years at Wipro Technologies, Kumar chose to leave behind his thriving career to pursue a mission close to his heart: revolutionizing the agricultural sector and uplifting rural communities. Co-founding Akshayakalpa Organic , India’s first certified organic dairy enterprise, Kumar aimed to empower marginalized farmers and foster sustainable agriculture . This initiative reflects his commitment to creating lasting social impact through innovation and entrepreneurship.Shashi Kumar’s journey began with an impressive academic and professional foundation. After earning a degree in computer science from Bengaluru University, he pursued a Master’s in Telecommunication Engineering from the Illinois Institute of Technology, Chicago. His career trajectory in the technology sector was remarkable, but his upbringing in a farming family planted the seeds for a deeper calling.Having witnessed the struggles of small farmers firsthand, Kumar carried a desire to make agriculture more viable. Despite his father’s warnings about the challenges of farming, Kumar felt a responsibility to address systemic issues such as low profitability and unsustainable practices. This realization culminated in the creation of Akshayakalpa Organic, a venture combining his technological expertise and passion for sustainable farming.Established with the vision of improving India’s dairy farming landscape, Akshayakalpa Organic is centered on empowering farmers and fostering rural entrepreneurship. The company helps farmers transition to organic practices by offering technical support, financial assistance, and access to markets.One of the unique aspects of Akshayakalpa is its focus on creating self-sustaining farming ecosystems. For example:These practices not only enhance productivity but also contribute to environmental sustainability.With a target turnover of Rs 400 crore in the current fiscal year, Akshayakalpa’s success has attracted the support of the Rainmatter Foundation, a nonprofit initiative by Zerodha founders Nithin and Nikhil Kamath. This partnership underscores the scalability of Akshayakalpa’s model, which aligns with the foundation’s mission to foster sustainable and impactful businesses.A core objective of Akshayakalpa Organic is to uplift farmers economically and socially. By collaborating with young farmers disillusioned with traditional agriculture, the company trains them to become independent entrepreneurs. According to the Rainmatter Foundation, farmers associated with Akshayakalpa earn an average monthly income of Rs 1,00,000 through diverse products like organic milk, poultry, honey, bananas, and millets.This consistent income shields farmers from challenges such as market volatility, dependence on middlemen, and unpredictable weather conditions. Beyond individual empowerment, Akshayakalpa’s model promotes community development by creating local employment opportunities and supporting sustainable farming practices.Akshayakalpa Organic has expanded its offerings to include a variety of organic products such as milk, fruits, vegetables, poultry, and honey. These products cater to the growing demand for healthier, eco-friendly alternatives in urban markets.Looking ahead, the company envisions becoming a pan-India brand, reaching new markets and influencing agricultural practices nationwide. Its success demonstrates the potential of combining innovation with sustainability to address long-standing challenges in Indian agriculture.
Article Summary: Akshayakalpa Organic is India’s first certified organic dairy enterprise. Founder Shashi Kumar aimed to empower marginalized farmers and foster sustainable agriculture. The company helps farmers transition to organic practices by offering technical support, financial assistance, and access to markets.

Article Title: Amazon CEO to Young Professionals: Positive attitude helps greatly in success, but you need to …
Article Text: Amazon CEO Andy Jassy says that an "embarrassing amount" of early career success depends on maintaining a positive attitude, particularly for professionals in their twenties. In a recent interview with LinkedIn CEO Ryan Roslansky , Jassy emphasized that while many career factors are beyond control, attitude remains firmly within one's grasp."I think people would be surprised how infrequently people have great attitudes," said Jassy, who has led the tech giant since Jeff Bezos stepped down in 2021. He noted that enthusiasm helps attract mentors and advocates, as "people want to be around positive people."However, Jassy cautioned that optimism alone isn't enough. Young professionals must back their positive outlook with concrete actions, including following through on commitments and maintaining a strong work ethic.The CEO, who joined Amazon as a marketing manager in 1997 and went on to launch Amazon Web Services , also stressed the importance of continuous learning throughout one's career. He warned against the complacency that can set in at senior levels, stating, "The second you think you know it all is the second you're really starting to unwind."Drawing from his own background, Jassy revealed that his early focus on competitive sports, including soccer and tennis, may have contributed to his business success. This aligns with research on Ivy League alumni showing that students who were heavily involved in athletics tend to achieve more senior positions and higher salaries in business careers than their non-athletic peers.Before joining Amazon, Jassy explored careers in sportscasting and music management. He ultimately helped build AWS into a crucial profit center that generated $13.5 billion of Amazon's $22.9 billion operating income by 2020, positioning him as Bezos's successor.
Article Summary: Amazon CEO Andy Jassy says that an "embarrassing amount" of early career success depends on maintaining a positive attitude. Jassy cautioned that optimism alone isn't enough. Young professionals must back their positive outlook with concrete actions, he said.

Article Title: Chromecast, VPN by Google One and other products that Google killed in 2024
Article Text:
Google Jamboard (2017 – 2024)



Chromecast (2013 – 2024)



VPN by Google One (2020 – 2024)



Dropcam (2009 – 2024)



Google Podcasts (2018 – 2024)



Keen (2020 – 2024)



In 2024, Google once again made headlines by discontinuing several products and services. Known for its vast ecosystem of tools and platforms, Google has always embraced an experimental approach, regularly launching new projects while also sunsetting those that fail to meet its evolving strategic goals or user expectations. This year was no exception, as Google said goodbye to offerings that had carved out unique niches but ultimately fell short of the tech giant’s ambitions. From Jamboard to the Chromecast , 2024 saw the end of products that, despite their promise, could not sustain relevance in an ever-competitive market. Here’s a list of products that Google killed in 2024Introduced in 2017, Jamboard was a digital 4K touchscreen whiteboard designed to facilitate real-time collaboration, integrating seamlessly with Google Workspace services. Despite its innovative approach to enhancing team interactions, Google decided to discontinue Jamboard in 2024, citing a strategic shift towards software-based solutions that offer greater flexibility and accessibility across diverse devices.Launched in 2013, Chromecast revolutionized media streaming by allowing users to cast content from their devices directly to their televisions. Over its 11-year lifespan, Chromecast sold over 100 million units, becoming a staple in many households. However, in August 2024, Google announced the discontinuation of the Chromecast line, signaling a move towards more integrated smart TV solutions and advanced streaming devicesAs part of its Google One subscription service, Google introduced a virtual private network (VPN) in 2020, offering users enhanced online privacy by encrypting internet traffic and masking IP addresses. Despite the growing emphasis on online security, the service experienced low adoption rates. Consequently, Google shut down VPN by Google One in June 2024, redirecting resources to other security initiatives.Dropcam, a pioneer in Wi-Fi-enabled security cameras, was acquired by Google in 2014. It allowed users to monitor their homes remotely via live video feeds. In April 2024, Google ended support for Dropcam and Dropcam Pro, encouraging users to transition to the more advanced Nest Cam lineup, which offers enhanced features and better integration with the Google ecosystem.Google Podcasts was launched in 2018 as a platform for discovering and listening to podcasts. Despite amassing over 500 million downloads, the app faced criticism for lacking features compared to competitors. In June 2024, Google announced the discontinuation of Google Podcasts, urging users to migrate to YouTube Music, which now includes podcast support.Keen, introduced in 2020, was an experimental project from Google's Area 120 incubator, aiming to rival Pinterest by allowing users to curate content based on their interests. Despite its unique approach to content discovery, Keen struggled to gain a substantial user base and was shut down in March 2024.The discontinuation of these products reflects Google's dynamic approach to its product lineup, continually reassessing and realigning its offerings to focus on areas with greater user engagement and strategic importance. While the end of these services may disappoint some users, it underscores Google's commitment to innovation and adaptability in the ever-evolving tech landscape.
Article Summary: Google announced the discontinuation of several products and services in 2024. Jamboard was a digital 4K touchscreen whiteboard designed to facilitate real- time collaboration, integrating seamlessly with Google Workspace services.Dropcam, a pioneer in Wi-Fi-enabled security cameras, was acquired by Google in 2014.

Article Title: Zomato thanks Delhi man for sharing “The Story of Shiva Sarkar”; company asks for …
Article Text:
Here’s the LinkedIn post shared by Bohra

𝐓𝐡𝐞 𝐒𝐭𝐨𝐫𝐲 𝐨𝐟 𝐒𝐡𝐢𝐯𝐚 𝐒𝐚𝐫𝐤𝐚𝐫

Last night, after wrapping up my work at 3 AM, I ordered my food through Zomato. As the doorbell rang, I stood up to open it. There he was, Shiva Sarkar, the delivery executive, with a warm smile despite the biting cold outside.

But there was something in his eyes. A heaviness, a story untold.

I invited him in, offered him some water, and gently asked if he was okay. What followed left me deeply shaken.

Shiva, barely 20-21 years old, broke down in tears as he shared his story. He had to drop out of school after 8th grade when his father passed away. The weight of responsibility forced him to take up this job to support his family.

His dreams of education, of a carefree youth, were replaced by long nights and the heavy burden of ensuring his sisters could be married next year. I sat there, in awe of his strength. This young man, who should be chasing his aspirations, is instead running against the clock to make ends meet, with a determination that can only be admired.

As we chatted, I couldn't help but think, how many more Shivas are out there? Young boys and girls sacrificing their education, their dreams, their potential, just to keep their families afloat.

Shiva left with a smile and a “Thank you.” But I was left with a storm of emotions. What could we do for them? Could Zomato, a platform so impactful, introduce upskilling programs, scholarships or easy loans for these unsung heroes?

What if these delivery executives could dream again? Could learn skills that open doors to brighter futures while earning a living?

Deepinder Goyal, I love the Zomato app, but can we do more? Can we, as a society, step up for these individuals who quietly carry the weight of the world on their young shoulders?

I have some plans in mind for him and will do my best to help him wherever I can.

P.S. I took his photo with his consent, and he’s fully supportive of any assistance provided.

How Zomato responded

Zomato delivery executive Shiva Sarkar's heartwarming encounter with a Delhi resident has gone viral on the internet. Shiva, a determined young man in his early twenties, caught the attention of Himanshu Bohra , a Delhi-based professional, who shared a post on LinkedIn, sharing his inspiring story. In the post, Bohra writes that despite facing the immense challenge of losing his father, Shiva works tirelessly to support his family. He also tagged Zomato and its CEO Deepinder Goyal seeking ways as to how society can help individuals like him.He writes “Deepinder Goyal, I love the Zomato app, but can we do more? Can we, as a society, step up for these individuals who quietly carry the weight of the world on their young shoulders? I have some plans in mind for him and will do my best to help him wherever I can.” In the LinkedIn post, he also shared a photo of the Zomato delivery executive.The post caught Zomato’s attention, which has responded seeking order ID to express appreciation to the delivery partner.Zomato replied to the Bohra’s post saying “Hey Himanshu, thanks for bringing this to our attention. This looks quite inspirational, and we are proud of our delivery universe.” Adding further, the company said “If possible, kindly help us with the order ID via a private message so that we can express your appreciation to our delivery partner.”
Article Summary: Zomato delivery executive Shiva Sarkar's heartwarming encounter with a Delhi resident has gone viral on the internet. Shiva, a determined young man in his early twenties, caught the attention of Himanshu Bohra, a Delhi-based professional, who shared his inspiring story. Zomato has responded seeking order ID to express appreciation to the delivery partner.

Article Title: Elon Musk wants to create in Texas what no other company and business leader has ever done
Article Text:
Representative Image

What happens when Starbase comes into existence



Elon Musk is moving forward with plans to create a dedicated town for SpaceX and its employees in Texas. SpaceX staff have submitted a petition to establish a new municipality named Starbase in coastal South Texas, home to the company’s rocket launch facilities. A SpaceX security manager is expected to serve as the town’s first mayor.Over the years, Musk has shifted his operations from California to Texas, developing facilities across several counties. Musk has been envisioning the Starbase town for years, but recently progress accelerated as SpaceX employees started moving into nearby homes and temporary housing near the launch site.According to a report by the New York Times, residents working for SpaceX filed an official petition with Cameron County to hold an election on incorporation this month. The document (seen by NYT) reveals initial plans for the city. If this city comes into existence, Musk will create history by doing something that no other company or business leader has ever done.The Starbase plan remained stalled for years, partly due to Texas laws requiring a minimum number of residents and majority voter support to establish a new municipality. However, SpaceX employees have started settling into refurbished homes and temporary housing near the company's rocket launch site, the report claims.This month, these residents took a step toward creating a new city by filing a petition with Cameron County to hold an election, revealing initial details about Elon Musk's vision for the proposed municipality.If approved, the election would allow voters to select three city officials, including Gunnar Milburn, SpaceX's security manager, as the proposed first mayor. The petition outlines a community of roughly 500 residents, including 219 primary residents and over 100 children, located near Boca Chica Beach at the end of State Highway 4. Covering about 1.5 square miles, the proposed town is small by Texas standards. Most residents are renters and work for SpaceX.However, the petition does not mention why Musk and SpaceX employees are pursuing the creation of Starbase or what benefits they aim to achieve. The proposed town could establish its own police or fire departments or enact its ordinances.Apart from this, Musk may also be looking into the possibility of housing employees in a development outside the town of Bastrop, near Austin. The area is home to a growing campus for Musk companies, including a manufacturing plant for SpaceX; the headquarters of the Boring Company, which is creating tunnelling technology; and, soon, offices for the social media platform X (earlier Twitter).
Article Summary: Residents working for SpaceX filed an official petition with Cameron County to hold an election on incorporation this month. A SpaceX security manager is expected to serve as the town’s first mayor. The petition outlines a community of roughly 500 residents, including 219 primary residents and over 100 children, located near Boca Chica Beach.

Article Title: 11 years, 950 million users … Telegram reports its first ever profit
Article Text:
Representative Image

Messaging platform Telegram has achieved its first-ever profit in 2024, marking a major milestone for the controversial chat app 11 years after its founding, CEO Pavel Durov announced Monday.The company's revenue exceeded $1 billion this year, nearly triple its 2023 figure of $342 million, driven by advertising and premium subscriptions. Telegram also reported $500 million in cash reserves, excluding cryptocurrency holdings.The profitability announcement comes as Telegram faces mounting global scrutiny over content moderation. Durov is currently unable to leave France following his August arrest over allegations of enabling criminal activity on the platform.The messaging service, which claims approximately 950 million users, has expanded its monetization efforts through multiple channels. Its premium subscription service, launched in 2022, has attracted 12 million paying users at $4.99 monthly. The company has also introduced revenue-sharing for content creators, business-tier subscriptions, and a mini app store.Telegram has made progress addressing its substantial debt obligations, repaying what Durov described as a "meaningful share" of its $2 billion in bonds this fall. The company had previously discussed the possibility of going public.Despite its financial success, Telegram continues to face regulatory challenges worldwide. Several countries, including Spain , Germany, and the UK, have considered bans or sanctions over the platform's minimal content moderation and alleged spread of misinformation. The service remains banned in China, Thailand , and Iran.The company has responded to some concerns by expanding its content moderation team to over 750 contractors. Durov maintains that the platform can achieve financial sustainability while "staying independent and respecting users' rights."
Article Summary: Telegram announces its first-ever profit in 2024. The company's revenue exceeded $1 billion this year, nearly triple its 2023 figure of $342 million. CEO Pavel Durov is currently unable to leave France following his August arrest over allegations of enabling criminal activity on the platform.

Article Title: Trading in Bharat Global Developers shares halted: What Zerodha CEO Nithin Kamath warned on 'Baap of Chart' and Trafiksol ITS Technologies
Article Text:
Zerodha CEO Nithin Kamath's 'warning' to investors

Scam stories: 'Baap of Chart' and Trafiksol ITS Technologies

The Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi) has halted trading in Bharat Global Developers ' shares following concerns over an unusual price surge. The suspension comes in response to a complaint filed on December 16, accompanied by social media posts questioning the company’s financial transparency. The complaint pointed to an extraordinary rise in the company’s share price, which skyrocketed 105 times between November 2023 and November 2024.The price jumped from Rs 51.43 per share on December 26, 2023, to Rs 1,236.45 per share by December 23, 2024, a massive increase of 2,304%. The suspension once again highlights dangers of investing in stocks without strong fundamentals. This comes close on heels of SEBI imposing a fine of Rs 19 lakh on Sai Proficient Research Investment Advisory and its proprietor for regulatory violations, including misleading investors with false promises of returns.As Zerodha CEO Nithin Kamath too recently warned investors about prevalent stock market scams, citing two recent SEBI orders involving Trafiksol ITS Technologies IPO and "Baap of Chart." In a long post on X, formerly Twitter, and a blog post. In the blog, Kamath emphasized that seeking quick profits is a recipe for losing money.Kamath highlighted two distinct scams: One involving an SME IPO that raised Rs 44 crore to purchase software from a shell company with fabricated financials and a bogus client list, and another involving a financial influencer ("finfluencer") who amassed Rs 17 crore by selling courses and seminars. He reiterated the adage, "if something is too good to be true, it almost always is."Zerodha's blog post elaborated on these cases. The first involved an IPO where funds were supposedly earmarked for software acquisition from a vendor that turned out to be a shell company incapable of delivering the promised software. Despite this, the IPO was oversubscribed 345 times. The post outlined three key takeaways from SEBI's order: the vendor's lack of operational capability, fabricated financials and a fake client list, and a suspicious vendor selection process. SEBI had previously halted the Trafiksol ITS Technologies SME IPO pending investigation and subsequently ordered the company to refund investors.The second case involved "Baap of Chart," a finfluencer who promised high returns and ran an unauthorized investment advisory service, collecting significant sums from investors. SEBI's investigation revealed that he was not providing free advice but rather operating an unregistered advisory service. SEBI subsequently barred Nasiruddin Ansari and his associates from the securities market and ordered them to refund investors.Kamath has consistently addressed such fraudulent activities. He recently warned about the potential dangers of AI-driven scams, referencing a case where a Bengaluru techie lost ₹91 lakh in an online stock market scam. This underscores the increasing sophistication of scams and the need for investor vigilance.
Article Summary: Sebi has halted trading in Bharat Global Developers'shares following concerns over an unusual price surge. The suspension once again highlights dangers of investing in stocks without strong fundamentals. This comes close on heels of SEBI imposing a fine of Rs 19 lakh on Sai Proficient Research Investment Advisory and its proprietor.

Article Title: Viewsonic: Monitors today are far more than just panels
Article Text:

The LCD vs OLED debate

With added features like wireless compatibility and built-in batteries, we’re seeing a transformation in the Asia-Pacific region, and these trends are shaping the Indian market as well.”ViewSonic confirmed that the rollout of its new monitor lineup, featuring 18-19 SKUs, will begin by January-end or early February 2025. Customers today are ready to invest in quality, and this positions us for positive growth."While debating if the superior OLED panels will overtake the LCD market anytime soon, the company said that it is way too soon for such a transformation. Despite OLED technology offering superior quality, LCD will remain dominant in the monitor market for some time. The company sees LCD technology to remain as the industry standard, with innovations like mini-LED backlighting bridging the gap between LCD and OLED performance.Oscar noted.The penetration of OLED monitors globally is currently around 2%, a stark contrast to LCD's widespread adoption.Oscar highlighted.
